name: The Consulate Midtown
address: 44 W 56th St, New York, NY 10019, USA

reviews.text: I enjoyed a wonderful experience for dinner! The low-lit setting was lovely.  The service was impeccable, and everyone was both gracious and friendly.  The roasted, deboned chicken was delicious.
Great happy hour.
Torres and Suzanna are both amazing and they are so talented and so much fun to work for them I love there services
Order the lamb tartare. Order it for lunch. Order it for dinner. And, order it with fries.

We had an amazing time at the Consulate!! We came to celebrate our anniversary and my birthday and we had the best time! The staff was so attentive and helpful and offered us complimentary champagne for the occasion. We ordered the escargot and oysters to start and they were phenomenal. My husband ordered the short rib cavatelli and I ordered the mushroom gnocchi for dinner. Both were exceptional. We didn‚Äôt leave any left over! For dessert we ordered the special (I unfortunately don‚Äôt remember the name) but it was delicious. It was similar to a large meringue cookie with cream and fruit. They also surprised us with a complimentary cr√®me br√ªl√©e for my birthday. We can‚Äôt recommend this restaurant enough!! They are fantastic!
El restaurante s√∫per acogedor con un bar bell√≠simo. Todo lo que comimos estuvo de lujo, riqu√≠simo. Nos atendi√≥ Marvin y el servicio fu√© excelente. De fijo volveremos ‚ù§Ô∏è

Juan was absolutely amazing and attentive. My husband is a tad broader in the shoulders and they moved us to a spot to be more comfortable. The food was superb and the band was fantastic. Im just sad i didnt know about this place sooner!
Wonderful service,  fabulous service!
Attentive service, delicious food, and prices aligned with both.  You could have a nice night out or a business meeting here and feel right at home.

Excellent service, food and venue.
Thank you Marvin.
Really enjoyed this spot!
Sat at the bar and had a great experience!! Thanks Kevin for amazing drinks!
Amazing service by Juan and delicious food with beautiful live jazz music! Our 2nd visit and we will be back!

This was the first time we ate at this restaurant. We loved everything we ordered from the French onion soup to the mussels to the chicken and grilled octopus. And our server, Juan, was a delight. He was very attentive and so friendly. We would definitely go back. .
Juan was an amazing and attentive waiter! Food was incredible
Great atmosphere and food! Caesar was awesome
A lovely meal in a beautiful setting.  Service was responsive from our waiter Juan and the rest of the team.  Food was delicious and beautifully presented.  Would recommend!
Beautiful atmosphere! And Cesar was a fantastic server.
We had a fabulous brunch. Service was great from the moment we sat down. Our waiter Cesar was excellent. Food was top notch, everything cooked perfectly.
Juan provided excellent service and all of the food was delicious. Great vibe
Gustavo was amazing

The meal and dessert were delicious! This is the first time in the U.S. that a waiter has asked me how I wanted my duck breast with foie gras cooked. As a French expatriate from the southwest of France, where duck breast and foie gras are a specialty, it gave me high hopes‚Äîand it was absolutely delicious! My cocktail was also full of flavors and not too strong in alcohol. I highly recommend this restaurant!
Kevin,  thank you so much for the great service and attention to detail.   The dinner was delicious and our little one loved falling asleep on the sofa!  Cheers!
Thanks Marvin
The perfect menu and vibes! Service with Kevin with delightful!

We tried The Consulate because of the high number reviews, but it did not live up to expectations. The biggest disappointment was the food. The oysters tasted like they had been rinsed in tap water - no saltiness or brine, no ocean water. To our waiter‚Äôs credit, he took them off the bill.

The rest of our dinner was also incredibly under-salted. The escargots, the gnocchi with mushrooms and truffles, even the seasonal duck breast. I‚Äôve never before had to ask for salt in a brasserie.

For good seating, you have to go up a long flight of stairs, which was not possible for our 90 year old mother.

I think they mean well, but it seemed like they really don‚Äôt know how to prepare excellent food. I would not recommend for dinner. Probably a nice spot for drinks and some appetizers - there‚Äôs a decent zinc bar type situation on the first floor, and also standing tables in the back.
A wonderful meal all around!  Caesar provided excellent service. Recommend!
Juan was a fantastic server
Juan was a phenomenal server! Great service, great advice about the city, great vibe in the restaurant - we had a fantastic time at The Consolate, would highly recommend!

We are staying nearby at the Park Lane and wanted ceviche and so we found the consulate! Their happy hour is incredible. We got ceviche, fish tacos, oysters, and cocktails and it was all delicious. Kevin and Gustavo were incredible bartenders. We‚Äôd love to come back!
The bone marrow was superb!  We also loved the fish and chips and escargot!  Kevin at the bar was the perfect host!  Thank you so much!
Juan was amazing and the food was outstanding!

Great experience. Good atmosphere, particularly given it was a Sunday night, busy but not overly so. Excellent service from Juan and Santo - we felt very looked after. Food exceptional as you would expect. Thanks very much - a special birthday meal for my wife (and noted the two couples next to us were also celebrating their birthdays too).
Delicious food! I had to try the lamb carpaccio and it was everything I had hoped. The Larisa is a great virgin cocktail for those who are looking for a delicious treat.
Kevin was amazing!
Juan is the best!! Stunning service and food
Marvin was a great server and good is awesome
Kevin service  was amazing ü§©
The food was great, with pretty big portions. Our server, Caesar, was very attentive and friendly. Would come back again!
Went for my birthday! Great live music and nice ambience! Juan was an amazing and very attentive server! Highly recommended!!
The place offer the very authentic French food and the vibe is comfy. Server Juan is really helpful and polite. Recommend this place!!!
Such a great experience. Food was delicious. Our waiter Juan was very good and guided us through the entire meal efficiently.

We had a lovely family dinner, and everything was wonderful. The food was delicious, with great flavors and generous portions. Marvin was an excellent host‚Äîvery attentive, helpful, and guided us perfectly with both drinks and food. His warm hospitality made the evening even more enjoyable‚Ä¶
Best French Restaurant In NYC! Best Ribeye Steak I‚Äôve ever had.

The service is fantastic, Marvin was great and very helpful and attentive. The food was great, flavor was phenomenal. The setting is romantic and not loud, very quaint and you‚Äôre not sat on top of other people.
We love The Consulate! Both food and service are always amazing. Marvin was great. We always love coming back here!
Marvin was the best. This was a wonderful 50th birthday celebration!
Marvin is an excellent server!
Marvin was a great server. He was attentive to our needs and we had a great night . Thanks Marvin
Good and affordable - delicious

Ville BlancheÎûë Malalama ÎßàÏÖ®ÎäîÎç∞ Ville Blanche ÏóÑÏ≤≠ ÎßõÏûàÏóàÏñ¥Ïöî!! KevinÏù¥ ÏπµÌÖåÏùº ÏûêÏÑ∏ÌïòÍ≤å ÏÑ§Î™ÖÌï¥Ï§¨Ïñ¥Ïöî!! :):) ÏùºÏöú ÎÇÆÏãúÍ∞ÑÏóî Ï°∞Ïö©ÌïòÍ≥† Î∂ÑÏúÑÍ∏∞ Ï¢ãÏïÑÏÑú Îòê Ïò¨ Í≤É Í∞ôÏïÑÏöî

A memorable French dining experience ‚Äî the cuisine was fresh and refined, the ambience warm and inviting, and the service outstanding. Juan was an excellent server, attentive and professional, making the evening truly special. The live jazz trio added great atmosphere, though it can get a bit loud if seated nearby.

Walked in on a Sunday and we were pleasantly surprised with everything -- the ambience, the friendly service, the well-balanced cocktails (love the Lola!) and the perfectly-cooked steaks and sides (love the Brussel Sprouts with Bacon).
Kudos to the whole team for a great dinner!

This restaurant was a real gastronomic delight! From the moment we walked in, the staff was extremely friendly and attentive. We didn't wait long to be served, and the waiter helped us with recommendations from the menu, which meant a lot to us since it was our first time here. The food was incredibly fresh, beautifully served, and rich in flavor. The music and ambiance are perfect for a business dinner, date and celebration. Highly recommend visiting as soon as possible!

The Consulate Midtown is a beautiful restaurant and we were greeted with a smile and kind hostess. We were seated at a quiet upstairs table per my reservation request.

As far as the service I‚Äôm truly torn. Our server was very nice, but seemed she might be new, if not, she should know more about the drinks and menu.

Everyone enjoyed their specialty cocktails. I will add that the Tito‚Äôs vodka soda w/a splash of cranberry was $24 +$7 for an extra shot ‚Äî $31! It didn‚Äôt even taste like a double. We know drinks are pricey and are fine with it, but seriously?

And then it was time for appetizers. I wanted the Tartare Trio (tuna, salmon, crab), but I don‚Äôt eat salmon, so requested to switch it for another of the offerings within the trio, to which I was told ‚Äúwe can not do that.‚Äù I did not ask to switch the salmon to lobster tail, so this was very off putting and I decided to forego an appetizer all together (they lost $22 and a star on this review for declining that very easy accommodation).

The other appetizers a pork rib special and crab cake were all very good.

When it came to ordering our entrees we all decided on steak; two filet mignon and two rib-eye. Again I asked to substitute the mashed potatoes for crispy mushrooms (exact same price on the menu) I was told she would have to check with the chef. However, my husband was able to choose any side with his rib-eye, so he ordered the mushrooms and we just swapped.

Both of the filets were delicious and the crispy mushrooms were fabulous. Unfortunately, my husband and our friend who ordered the rib-eyes medium rare were given medium. Anyone that orders steak and has to send it back knows it‚Äôs a kill joy for the meal, so they both said the flavor was decent and they would just eat them.

We were full and decided to pass on dessert, BUT, our server brought out a Creme Br√ªl√©e for our friend‚Äôs anniversary. That was extremely kind and appreciated.

As we were leaving, the same hostess was kind enough to take a few photos of us.

Overall our experience was clearly mixed. The problem is in NYC where there‚Äôs so many restaurants to choose from, you really have to hit all the marks. So, we‚Äôre not sure if we‚Äôd go again.

Our waiter Marvin is great! He recommended the special dishes for tonight. Lamb tartare & Bone marrow are amazing. I like the fig sauce. Duck breast is good enough given its price(I like the pumpkin puree more). Wagyu burger is average. This place is pretty close to where I work so I would come next time.

Marvin was an excellent server. The entire staff was wonderful. The food was top notch. We have never had bone marrow with so much marrow inside and it was amazingly delicious. The octopus was divine! The Bronzino was delicious And the short rib was cooked perfection. The absolute best mushrooms I have ever had. It‚Äôs a must try.The chocolate cr√®me br√ªl√©e did not disappoint,  it was decadent The atmosphere was romantic.

Absolutely great space. Beautiful bar area and gorgeous staircase leading up to the second floor seating which offers privacy should you plan a private party. Great service, attentive and friendly staff. On the food side‚Ä¶ getting there. IMO, it lacks finesse both in taste and presentation. What I am about to say, mind you, is all criticism on high-level. For instance, if a cream-based soup is not balanced with acidity you won‚Äôt be able to eat more than 3 spoons until your stomach tells you: enough. The celery-apple soup, a long-time favorite in my household, didn‚Äôt offer the sweet and tart apple taste it needs to counter the heavy cream. The French onion soup, IMO one of the best ones in midtown, was filled tongue brim the brim and then overflowed when baked. And my goodness, be gentle on the amount of cheese you want to melt..  and then the pasta dish: why add cream to short rib ragout? It makes it look unappealing and is also not necessary for taste. Tasteless good though, but again, the heavy cream will not allow you to eat much. Again, high-level critique and I would return. But a gentle nudge to the chef to keep finessing so the restaurant will earn its place in the most-desired category.

My favorite from this restaurant is lamb tartar!!! And ginger cocktail.

We also ordered grilled octopus, steak frites and duck - everything was delicious!

And our server was the best (I‚Äôm not sure if I spell his name right - Bochi), he made sure we had a great experience in the restaurant!

Atmosphere in the restaurant was great too!

The entire experience was phenomenal. The management at the front door was kind and welcoming and seated me in their gorgeous dining room. Kevin was a highly attentive server and treated me like a true VIP. I recommend the bone marrow and filet mignon. Be sure to finish with the luxurious lava cake.
We had a wonderful brunch there! Ambience, food, and service were great! Best French omelette I‚Äôve ever had! Cesar was our server and he was extremely nice and attentive! I highly recommend it!

This beautiful French restaurant may not have an extensive menu, but it offers more variety than expected with daily specials and seasonal options.

Every dish exceeded expectations in taste, the service was friendly, and above all, the atmosphere was wonderful.

The only downside was the limited wine selection, but the reasonable pricing made up for it.

Dinner was unforgettable. Chef Alan Vargas is a true talent. Every dish was flawless. It‚Äôs been over 10 years since I‚Äôve had a meal that good. Ceaser and Marvin‚Äôs service was the perfect complement. I give it a 10/10.

Came for birthday and I'm really glad I chose this place to celebrate my birthday. We had a late reservation but we didn't feel rushed. Decor is beautiful, food was delicious, and staff was very attentive and welcoming. We had the Lamb shank speciality dinner, grilled octopus, broccolini, and mushrooms. The drink I had was delicious AND strong. Thank you to our waiter, Kevin.

Super high-quality foods with great wine selections. The server forgot the extra order I made one time and didn't get a new glass for the new wine, so that was quite disappointing, but except for that, I was overall satisfied.
Great cocktails, Kevin is great. He was able to make even a novelty cocktail well. Great drink nice atmosphere what more can you ask for.

Beautiful and comfortable environment. Enjoyed the delicious food, pleasant atmosphere and friendly service. Love the caviar. The vegetables are tasty. My sister and I had a wonderful time dining and chatting. Had fun taking photo by the stair with my sister and owner Miki. Great for families and friends gathering. Love to come back again and again.

We had such a wonderful experience at this restaurant in New York! The food was absolutely amazing ‚Äì fresh, flavorful, and perfectly prepared. Every dish we tried was delicious. The service was just as impressive. A special thank you to Juan, who made us feel so welcome and taken care of throughout the evening.

We were celebrating my husband‚Äôs birthday, and the staff went above and beyond to make the night extra special for us. Their kindness and attention to detail really made the celebration memorable.

Highly recommend this spot for anyone looking for fantastic food and outstanding service. We can‚Äôt wait to come back!
Gem in the area! Wonderful Happy Hour drinks and bites too! I‚Äôve had dinner here too, it was really good! Host and waiters are very friendly. Atmosphere is beautiful as well. Highly recommend!

What a stunning restaurant located in the heart of Midtown. This establishment is beautifully designed inside. The menu is awesome, the food was great, and the service was excellent.  We couldn't recommend the Consulate highly enough, and we will definitely be returning!

Stopped by after an event at the MoMA down the street and was impressed by the cozy, dimly lit, lowkey vibes of the place.

Was even more surprised by the delicious quality of the food. Did light bites and drinks but remember the cocktails being nice and strong, the bone marrow being rich and the tuna tartare being layered with flavor including a nice bit of avocado for consistency.
We had a fantastic experience at The Consulate. Juan was our server and he was lovely! We stumbled on it by accident but we will be back! The bone marrow and the short rib cavatelli are a MUST.

Gustavo was our server and he was AMAZING!! On top of what we needed. That food was amazing and the drinks were flowing. As a married couple of 3 kids we appreciated how much Gustavo took care of us. Highly recommend this place!! And Gustavo!!

Me and my husband booked a table for 13 for a post wedding lunch last October 11, 2024. I have nothing but positive to say for our lunch event. We had a nice and quiet table on the second floor and all our servers were very professional and friendly. They gave us a free champagne and came out with two sparklers for me and my husband. We found this very sweet and got really nice photos out of it! The food was delicious and everyone enjoyed their meal from the starters to mains and desserts! They far outweighed our expectations and we are very content and happy. I have no regrets choosing them for our wedding lunch. The ambience was also perfect even though it was lunch time, the lighting inside made us feel like we were having a nice relaxed dinner which we liked and was exactly the ambience we were looking for. Overall, I highly recommend and want to say thanks to the events team and The Consulate!
The thing that made the mussels good was 100% the butter wine concoction; tuna tartare had the perfect amount of lime; pesto was fine; and the creme br√ªl√©e was ü´∂üèΩ

We had a wonderful evening and dinner at The Consulate. We chose to go there to celebrate our anniversary. We could not have chosen a better place! The service was outstanding; the food was impeccable and delicious, and the ambience perfect. The meal was superb. We give our evening 5, wholehearted stars. Kudos to the wait staff, bartender, and chef. A well-crafted experience! Thank you for making our anniversary night so nice!

My favorite spot for lunch in Midtown! Torianna is a welcoming presence behind the bar, crafting fantastic cocktails, giving great menu recommendations, and adding to the warm atmosphere with her kindness and wit. My favorite dishes are the croque monsieur on Tuesdays, the tuna sandwich on Wednesdays and the avocado and salmon toast on Fridays. In terms of cocktails, the Malalama, Ginger Optional, French 76 and Consulate Old Fashioned are all wonderfully crafted and delicious.

Things I liked: even on a busy night the restaurant was still quiet with well-sized tables and nice decor. The bar is very cute. Presentation of dishes is nice. People liked the lobster risotto.
Things that underwhelmed me: the gnocchi was more generic in flavor It had mostly slightly saut√©ed button mushrooms and a slight truffle aroma but nothing that carried through into the taste.
Service was fine.

Went there for lunch and really enjoyed it. The atmosphere was very nice‚Äîquiet and perfect for conversation. Service was excellent and fast. The food was delicious, and the desserts were outstanding!
Happy hour is great. The drinks are delicious and the appetizers are very good. Kevin was our waiter, he was so sweet and very attentive! One happy mom and daughter date!

Had an amazing dining experience at The Consulate in Midtown! The ambiance was stylish yet cozy, the service was top-notch, and the food was absolutely delicious. Every dish was beautifully presented and full of flavor‚Äîhighly recommend the Steak Frites and Short Rib Cavatelli which we were able to order with GF pasta üòçüòçüòç. Whether you're looking for a great lunch, dinner, or cocktails, this spot does not disappoint. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!
We had a wonderful anniversary dinner. Cesar and team were excellent from the time we arrived to the time we left. The food was fantastic and memorable. Thank you for a wonderful anniversary dinner.
This place ave such a delicious food and incredible service, everyone was so welcoming and created nice and caring atmosphere for us. We really enjoyed

This place has it all! The brunch menu is fantastic, with everything from perfect omelets to indulgent Eggs Benedict. The avocado toast is fresh and satisfying, and the pancakes are fluffy and sweet. For dinner, the burgers are juicy and delicious. It‚Äôs a great spot for big groups with a welcoming, easy-going vibe.
Wife took me here for my special 30th birthday. Food and atmosphere were amazing. The server's attentive and personalized service truly made our dining experience unforgettable!

Only came in here for drinks after having dinner next door at blue willow! The host Natalie was pleasant and very accommodating with seating as the bar was full and bartender Kevin was great as well! He brought out our drinks to us as we were seated away from the bar. Can‚Äôt wait to comeback another time to dine in and for more drinks!

Had a business lunch at The Consulate and loved it.  The tuna tartare was beautifully presented and the perfect start to the meal.  The service was stellar and the dining room on the second floor was beautifully designed.  The tuna sandwich and perfectly cooked fries were equally satisfying.  Look forward to having the excuse to come back for happy hour to try more.  Loved my time here.
The food and service were excellent, and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. It‚Äôs also a wonderful place to go on a date with a girl you like ‚Äî perfect for spending quality time togethÔºÅ
We didn't eat here but the drinks were fantastic. The bartender was excellent and made great recommendations.

Our server Cesar was attentive and kept the courses and beverages flowing in a smooth and timely manner. The food was exquisite (get the bone marrow! It is worth it even if you are not an adventurous eater! Spread it like butter across the bread!) and the atmosphere was perfect for an intimate date.
Amazing meal. Cesar was our waiter and was amazing - so kind, responsive and fast. We kept saying how good the service was. Very good classic American / French spot. Come hungry!!
